name: Glacier Bay NP — Lower Bay (AK)
info: NPS 'Whale Waters' update effective Aug 21 reported many humpbacks using the lower bay; 13-knot vessel speed limit in effect to reduce disturbance.

name: Juneau — Auke Bay / Stephens Passage (AK)
info: Active bubble-net feeding observed on a Juneau tour (Gastineau Guiding) with repeated coordinated lunges.

name: Glacier Bay NP — Whale Waters Notice (AK)
info: Park update (Aug 9) noted shifting feeding activity and implemented a new 'Whale Waters' speed limit to protect humpbacks in the lower bay.

name: Sitka Sound — near Sitka (AK)
info: Local news reported a whale interaction near Sitka; vessel briefly lifted—indicative of very close surfacing behavior in the area that week.

name: Howe Sound — Hope Point, Gambier Island (BC)
info: Multiple Bigg’s groups (T90s, T36s, T124Ds) observed eastbound from Hope Point around 09:45; later update of the group southbound along the east side of Gambier late morning.

name: Deception Pass (WA)
info: Encounter with the T099s (including T099B146) moving with strong tidal currents through Deception Pass; naturalists reported spectacular current-driven surfacing sequences.

name: Cowichan Bay (BC)
info: Afternoon run up to Cowichan Bay to meet T063 'Chainsaw' and T065 'Whidbey II'; long looks as the pair cruised north.

name: Haro Strait (WA/BC border)
info: T19s documented moving southbound in Haro Strait with video; classic border run behavior.

name: Entrance to Hood Canal (WA)
info: Evening report places an orca at the Hood Canal entrance; contemporaneous period had T65As in the region.

name: Strait of Juan de Fuca — Olympic Peninsula (WA)
info: T046B1s traveling along the Strait beyond Port Angeles, with humpbacks also in the area; dramatic Olympic Mountains backdrop.

name: San Juan Islands — northbound (WA)
info: T018s/T019 family cruising the islands; classic mid-channel travel with foraging.

name: Strait of Georgia — Nanaimo (BC)
info: Morning trip found multiple humpbacks dozing and surfacing gently in the Salish Sea (Dalmatian, Geometry, Twinning, Niagara, Forge, Pingu and others).

name: Strait of Georgia — Nanaimo (BC)
info: Circle bubble-net feeding with Sergeant and Fallen Knight; Ghost traveling with her 2025 calf and Zorro nearby.

name: Strait of Georgia — Nanaimo (BC)
info: Afternoon 'humpback soup' with Moresby, Bullet, Hammer, Europa and calf, Kappa & Kappiroto, KEX0086, and Eros widely spread across the Strait.

name: Strait of Georgia — Nanaimo (BC)
info: Multiple humpbacks lunge-feeding including Twinning and Geometry; Kappa with 2025 calf and Valiant with 2025 calf also present.

name: Strait of Georgia — Gabriola Island (BC)
info: Quartet of humpbacks (Tempest, Twinning, Bond, Geometry) socializing with surface lunges; additional trio (Kappa, Kappiroto, Watson/Cerulean) fluking near Gabriola.

name: Strait of Georgia — Nanaimo (BC)
info: T065Bs and T101s reported in the Strait during afternoon tours; humpbacks also present in the same area.

name: Strait of Georgia — Halibut Bank (BC)
info: T065As by Halibut Bank with many humpbacks in the 'Nursery' area (multiple calves identified).

name: Victoria Inner Harbour (BC)
info: T109A matriline made a rare pass into Victoria’s Inner Harbour, hunting/playing among moored vessels.

name: Rosario Strait — North of Henry Island (WA)
info: Nine orcas socializing — the T018s together with the T109As — with long surface intervals and socializing at the surface.

name: Commencement Bay — Browns Point (WA)
info: Multiple reports of a humpback (CRC-22909 “Ulli”) milling near Browns Point and Tyee Marina; repeated fluking and breaches observed through the day.

name: Monterey Bay — Canyon Edge (CA)
info: Multiple humpbacks lunge-feeding; close looks at cooperative feeding along canyon edges.

name: Fremantle — off Rottnest Trench (WA)
info: Southbound migration pods meandering past Fremantle; scattered escort pods and bachelor males.

name: Perth — Gage Roads (WA)
info: Playful juvenile interacting at the surface; 'seaweed facial' noted by naturalists.

name: Hervey Bay — Platypus Bay (QLD)
info: Peak-season resting and socialising in World Whale Heritage waters; mother-calf pairs linger up to 10 days.

name: Hauraki Gulf — off Tiritiri Matangi (NZ)
info: Coastal orca passing southbound through the Gulf; common seasonal occurrence with intermittent prey-chasing.

name: Kaikōura — south of Goose Bay (NZ)
info: Pod including a very old bull reported; short coastal pass with occasional milling near tour vessels.

name: Stellwagen Bank — SW Corner (MA)
info: Five humpbacks including well-known individuals (Clamp, Brine, Owl, Sedge, Spoon) feeding and fluking.

name: Stellwagen Bank — Tillies Basin edge (MA)
info: Morning watch with many humpbacks and a finback; afternoon repeat activity with active surface feeding.

name: Maui — Auʻau Channel (HI)
info: Rare off-season humpback sighting near Maui reported by local operator; single whale in apparent good health.

name: Hawaiian Islands — Sanctuary/Great Whale Count (multi-island)
info: Volunteer shoreline surveys recorded hundreds of humpback sightings across Kauaʻi, Oʻahu, Molokaʻi and Hawaiʻi Island during peak season.

name: Kerama Islands — Zamami / Aka (Okinawa)
info: Mother-calf pairs and escorts in winter breeding grounds; repeated breaches and tail slaps observed.

name: Ogasawara (Bonin) Islands — Chichijima offshore (Tokyo)
info: Seasonal breeding aggregation; multiple singers and competitive groups reported around the island chain.

name: Rausu — Shiretoko Peninsula (Hokkaidō)
info: Peak-season coastal orca observed from nature cruise boats; multiple pods traveling along the Nemuro Strait.

name: Bremer Sub-Basin — Bremer Canyon (WA)
info: Multiple orca family groups cooperatively hunting large prey in canyon waters (seasonal hotspot).

name: Bar Harbor — Mount Desert Rock line (ME)
info: Active feeding humpbacks on offshore banks; frequent tail throws and bubble clouds.

name: Hauraki Gulf — outer Gulf (NZ)
info: Migrating humpback transiting through the Hauraki Gulf alongside common dolphins.

name: Hawaiian Islands — Ocean Count (multi-island)
info: Second volunteer count day of the season recorded numerous blows and breaches at shoreline stations.

name: Perth — Off Gage Roads (WA)
info: Perth Humpback Season 2025 kick-off trip; first southbound pods meandering near Gage Roads.

name: Perth — Rottnest Trench line (WA)
info: Surface-active juvenile and escort pair; rolling, tail slaps reported by crew.

name: Hervey Bay — Platypus Bay (QLD)
info: Mother–calf pair lingering in sheltered waters; repeated spyhops and gentle pec slaps typical of peak-season behavior.

name: New York Bight — off Rockaway (NY)
info: Two humpbacks seen on sunset trip; double lunge feeding noted earlier the same day.

name: New York Bight — off Breezy Point (NY)
info: Three humpbacks together; breaching and tandem travel.

name: New York Bight — near Ambrose Channel (NY/NJ)
info: Full-body breaching humpback observed repeatedly during afternoon tour.

name: New York Bight — Coney Island reef line (NY)
info: Five humpbacks; tail slaps, peduncle throws, and tandem swimming.

name: Stellwagen Bank — mid-bank (MA)
info: Named humpbacks 'Ravine' and 'Valley' traveling together; afternoon video posted by operator.

name: Stellwagen Bank — southwest corner (MA)
info: Two humpbacks observed on both morning and afternoon trips; unusual synchronous surfacing behavior noted.

name: Stellwagen Bank — northwest corner (MA)
info: Many humpbacks on both trips; lunge feeding with Atlantic white-sided dolphins nearby.

name: Hawaiian Islands — Sanctuary Ocean Count (multi-island)
info: Volunteer shoreline survey recorded widespread blows, breaches and tail slaps across sites on Oʻahu, Kauaʻi, Molokaʻi and Hawaiʻi Island.

name: Kerama Islands — Zamami Channel (Okinawa)
info: Multiple mother–calf pairs with escorts in protected channels; repeated breaches and competitive groups nearby.

name: Ogasawara — Chichijima offshore (Tokyo)
info: Singers and surface-active groups seen around island chain during breeding season.

name: Rausu — Nemuro Strait (Hokkaidō)
info: Coastal orca pods traveling along the Shiretoko Peninsula; peak viewing in June noted by operators.

name: Hauraki Gulf — off Rangitoto (NZ)
info: Coastal orca cruising southbound with dolphins; short pursuit behavior on rays reported by local group.

name: Hauraki Gulf — Waitematā entrance (NZ)
info: Migrating humpback transiting outer gulf alongside common dolphins; seen from Auckland Whale & Dolphin Safari route.

name: Kaikōura — south of Peninsula (NZ)
info: Operator report indicates tours based around humpbacks with 1–2 sightings per sailing amid rougher weather.

name: Bar Harbor — Mount Desert Rock line (ME)
info: Several humpbacks and fin whales noted on offshore cruise; lighthouse loop included.

name: Flinders Bay — Augusta (WA)
info: Season finale day; migrating pods departing Flinders Bay with active breaching and tail throws.

name: New York Bight — off Rockaway (NY)
info: Noon trip: two humpbacks double lunge feeding; evening trip maintained presence.

name: Stellwagen Bank — Tillies edge (MA)
info: Lots of whales on both AM/PM trips; surface feeding observed.
